body.p: The java code completion makes use of the new "User Defined Completion" added to vim 7.
To use the code completion use Ctrl-X Ctrl-U while in insert mode at the position you wish to start the completion from.
Once you have started the completion you can use Ctrl-N to procede to the next match and Ctrl-P for the previous match.

If you are like me and you find those key strokes a bit cumbersome, then you can use the excellent SuperTab plugin which allows you to use the Tab key for completion. However at this time SuperTab does not support the latest completion modes for vim 7, so I have patched it to add the necessary support. You can download the updated version in the downloads area.

To find out more about vim's insert completion use
:h ins-completion
from within vim.
